TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1017-1018
TEI.2.document_title: William Little to Stephen F. Austin, 01-13-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: William Little to Austin, January 13, 1825. Private land sales. Vital statistics.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1017-1018

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William Little to Austin, January 13, 1825. Private land sales. Vital statistics.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**location_mentioned*Fort Settlement*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="01-13-1825">13th Jany. 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p*I know so little of the situations of *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Mr Stafford*/person_mentioned* 's League*/location_mentioned* that I am unable to say positively that I will make Exchange with him if he has a good situation for stock at the *location_mentioned*Prairie*/location_mentioned* I think he can be accomodated with two hundred acres (not more.) by his paying all Expenses of surveying Transfers etc and obligating himself to move on to the land he may get of me with his *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*in the course of *date_mentioned n="Fall-1825">next fall*/date_mentioned*. I wish to have one or two good *person_mentioned*neighbours */person_mentioned*and will go as far as I can without loss to accomodate an industrious *person_mentioned*man*/person_mentioned* with a situation—I will be in *location_mentioned*Town */location_mentioned*as soon as the roads are so I can get up—we can then have a chat on the subject and no doubt make the arangement to suit all *person_mentioned*Parties*/person_mentioned*—Your *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*Sir, is increasing fast at least this *location_mentioned*bend of the Brasos*/location_mentioned*. on the morning of the *date_mentioned n="01-07-1825">7th*/date_mentioned* Inst *person_mentioned*Mrs Andrews*/person_mentioned* had Two fine *person_mentioned*Girls */person_mentioned*in the evening of the same day *person_mentioned*Mrs. Little*/person_mentioned* had a stout *person_mentioned*Boy*/person_mentioned*. all doing well—*person_mentioned*Mrs H Jones*/person_mentioned* had a *person_mentioned*son */person_mentioned*on *date_mentioned n="12-31-1824">last day of Decr*/date_mentioned*. */p* *p**person_mentioned*Wm Little*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*My *person_mentioned*Father */person_mentioned*will go to *location_mentioned*Town */location_mentioned*with me to arange our land as soon as we can get up.—he has been very unwell for some time but is getting better yours—*person_mentioned*W. L. [william Little]*/person_mentioned* */p* *p*Please to have the papers arranged so that may not have to stay long in *location_mentioned*Town*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*/div1*
